[h1]When papa Jeff left the company it was the first and the only red flag whole playerbase is ever needed.[/h1]

The can of worms is finally here...yay ?
We all purchased the game and had FREE Heroes, maps, game modes and skins. I have 2300 hours in Overwatch 1 (screenshot below) and NGL, not even one hour in what they called OW 2. I don't even know all types of monetization present in game these days. I've checked locked heroes. All except the new one which must be only purchased if I got it right (premium battle pass track), can be unlocked by playing the game, BUT if you are familiar with terms "Competitive Play" and "Meta", then you already know it's bull crap. A game, designed around changing heroes and adjusting to the enemy strategy decided to lock part of the strategy behind the paywall.

Blizzard has scammed Overwatch playerbase on multiple ocassions. From the message, when they said that all players SHOULD spend their in game currency, because, according to their words, it will have no use in OW 2 or even won't be transferred. Can't recall which one. Anyway. Surprise surprise. You still can buy some skins with the currency from OW 1, although they've increased price for the Legendary skins from 1000 to 1900 credits. So, here's also that. And finishing with fully scrapping PvE skill trees, which was the main selling feature (along with PvE missions ofc) for OW 2 paid version, when no one had a clue what's coming up next. Now, they've released 3 (?) missions, slapped 15$ price tag and called it a day. There's much more to discuss regarding predatory monetization, but let's not do this here. Who knows - knows.
Check out what we could have instead:
https://youtu.be/AWOsm3NwO0U?si=7e5yJnaZ7YRonaGY&t=308

Anyway, while I realize it may not be the healthy attitude, but I'm really glad with Steam reviews. Greedy bastards, finally got what they deserve.
Of course, there's also sht fest regarding how Dev Team was (is?) treated. You can check the video above, or google by yourself.

Once a truly Legendary Company, now just a flock of vultures. Rip Blizzard.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3018512820

PS: thx for free cheevos, bitches

Blizzard deserves all these because they don't care player's opinion and wants.
Please, don't forgot what you have promised.

If you want to get a good Overwatch experience, here are few steps:

1) Uninstall OW2.
2) Visit Phub and search Overwatch.
3) Enjoy.

[h1] I have been playing Overwatch since 2016 and my only regret is that I ever gave Blizzard any money. [/h1]


I purchased Overwatch way back in 2016 around a month after launch. Things seemed hopeful back then. 

I remember my first Play of the Game. I remember my first legendary skin. I remember Summer Games 2016, coinciding with the 2016 Summer Olympics in Brazil. I remember the first Junkenstein’s Revenge Halloween event. The point I’m making is that I remember what Overwatch used to be. It used to be the hip, new team based co-operative first person shooter that you could load up and have fun with your friends. It was GOTY 2016! 

Some time passed and I had stepped back from Overwatch, but grew excited when the news of a campaign-based story mode became public. Much later, I participated in the Overwatch 2 beta and despite everything, I was still somewhat hopeful. Overwatch’s cinematics have always been amazing and the game had an interesting enough story and lore. I figured that we would have a riveting campaign with the light RPG elements that Blizzard had promised with stat building and specialization. Myself, like many others, were hopeful that the years of waiting in relative radio silence would pay off and that Kaplan’s promises would become true. We would be able to dive into stories about Genji, Reaper, Hanzo, Ana and more. If the storytelling then was anything like in the cinematics and comics, we were in for a wonderful gaming narrative experience.

When the news broke earlier this year about the canceling of Overwatch 2’s campaign and that we would be receiving a butchered, neutered version of the Player VS Environment mode we had been promised for [b] THREE YEARS [/b] that would be playable by paying 15 dollars, it was the final nail in the coffin. Shortly thereafter I uninstalled the game and removed Battlenet from my PC. I could go more into about the various problems from the at times borderline racist and questionable choices the made during game’s development, the issues plaguing Blizzard as a company, the bizarre and out of touch balancing decisions, Overwatch League, formerly free content now having to be paid for, predatory marketing, the incredibly blundered and wasted opportunities and so much more. I will leave that however to more eloquent reviewers and other critics to avoid treading over the same ground again. More than enough reviews are already filled with scathing remarks. I don’t need to tell you that the game isn’t what it used to be and is a shell of its former self. 

[b] Overwatch has somehow, in the span of less than a decade, gone from a paragon of showing the best of what video games as an interactive medium have to offer as the veritable icon of sin itself in the gaming industry. [/b] (Did you know that Overwatch is largely responsible for the popularization of the term, “Hero Shooter”?). The fact that the game is on Steam is a final desperate attempt to squeeze what little money they can from this IP they’ve smothered.

I have only installed the game again on Steam to leave this review to provide myself some sort of degree of catharsis. Another review for Overwatch 2 stated that playing Overwatch was like a cycle of domestic abuse, with Overwatch being the abuser. The game I played, the game I enjoyed and maybe even loved in 2016 is long since gone and exists now only as a tainted burning memory viewed with equal amounts of nostalgia and disdain.

For a game about heroes and changing the world for the better, things have only turned for the worst. [b] As stereotypical as it is, maybe it really is true that you either die a hero or live long enough to see yourself become the villain. [/b]

Goodbye, Overwatch. May we never meet again.

动视暴雪，其父考迪克，因赃假位，铲除先朝老臣，狐假虎威，猥亵员工，饕餮资产，一篡逆谋反之辈，涂炭生灵。吾每每谈及使命召唤、守望先锋，无不扼腕叹息。
叹往昔使命召唤，神作之首，现如今，剥削玩家财产，不作为，摆烂赶工，如粪土一堆，污我双眸。看今朝守望先锋，吾常常心怀怒火，两泪纵横。
狗贼考迪克，岂不知天下人皆愿生啖你肉，痛饮你血！动视暴雪，已是乱臣当道的朽木，苍天已死，黄天当立！
即日并四海玩家，共取G胖老巢，讨伐暴雪！广宣恩信，班扬符赏，布告天下，咸使知暴雪有拘迫之难。如律令！
若敢来犯，必叫你人仰马翻，恶名远扬，差评如潮！贼将，你命休矣！

16年听同学推荐了这款游戏，但奈何没有可以支配的钱和性能卓越的电脑和高昂的售价组织了我加入守望先锋，但在19年换了9900kf+2080ti后果断购入了游戏，也是通过ow1 认识了我人生中最重要的朋友，在2022年我甚至专门去挂twitch去获得内测的资格，体验完后只能说就是单纯的答辩，一点之前答应的东西没做到，连免费的箱子也删了，只想要挣钱。再到现在和网易的决裂导致账号和服务器的删除，之前投入的时间和皮肤全都没了，本还想着明年能防成谜解封终于能玩了，结果还没到18他却先死了
